characters: INT. LIVING ROOM, LATER THAT NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE UP: Ornate antique GRANDFATHER CLOCK strikes 2:15. The credits begin to roll. Calligraphy place cards are painstakingly hand-written in preparation for a formal reception. Servants meticulously clean an elaborate crystal chandeli Hands rapidly shine silver cutlery. Fresh flowers arranged in several enormous vases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kitchen clock strikes 2:15. Poultry plucked. Feathers everywhere. Steaming copper pots boiling over. Platters prepared with decorative garnish. Extravagant tiered cake is lavishly iced. A glob of frost enters a pair of puckered lips. The perpetrator, a fey,  pompous, HEAD VALET, seriously considers the texture and  flavor of the icing, then gives the PASTRY CHEF a witheri sour look. The valet, oblivious to the chef's fury, gathers a prepar silver breakfast tray and checks his pocket watch. 2:15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Antique bedside table clock -- just past 2:15. The valet  throws open velvet drapes, sunlight FLOODS the room revea a figure sleeping soundly in a massive oak framed bed. Th valet puts down the tray, pulls back the quilt. The dozing figure gives the valet a deliberate, angry KIC Flinching infinitesimally, the valet crosses to the close selects three suits and holds them up for inspection. Fro beneath the puffiest of pillows, AN EYE reluctantly opens weary arm points decisively to the riding outfit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The riding outfit is adorned by LEOPOLD, Duke of Albany, dashing, virile man in his 30's. GALLOPING with great aba he expertly leads his horse up hills and over hedges. He  sends gardeners shaping the grounds fleeing from his path In the background, lanterns are being strung throughout t estate. Rugs are beaten out of open windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Large hallway clock -- 6:15. A pair of boots track a fres scrubbed floor as Leopold heads carelessly up the stairwa Three steps behind, the valet snaps his fingers signaling the staff to clean up the mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaudily framed portraits of somber relations. A bird sits listless in a gilded cage. Hot water is poured into a bath. Carriages begin to arrive. Orchestra leader signals the musicians to play. Guests fill the ballroom in formal attire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold stares haughtily into a full length mirror. He wears only dotted linen drawers and a black silk top h of the period. He flexes slightly. The valet hastily fast a corset around his mid-section from behind. Leopold eyes his reflection seductively. He becomes bored He turns to his right. The valet spoons sorbet from a sil saucer into his mouth. He turns back to the mirror to wat himself eat. The valet pats his mouth dry. He affects a pampered STRUT, crossing the room as the val sprays a mixture of perfume and powder into the air. Leop thrusts out his arms walking through the mist, turns and  saunters back to his favorite place, in front of the mirr Finally, as if weighing a great decision, Leopold hands h hat to his valet and nods firmly into the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine linen undervest slides over his head. Black twilled worsted trousers pulled up to his waist. The buttoning of his hard, white, roll collar. A cream suede glove stitched in black slides over his han A perfect tight bow tie is tied around his neck. An elegant black tuxedo jacket with silk facings and tail to the knees is fitted to his torso. His hair is sleeked with oil and centrally parted. His eyebrows are brushed with a tiny silver comb. His cheeks are pinched. A red silk handkerchief is placed in the bosom of his lap Leopold stares into the mirror. The effect is DAZZLING. H raises one eyebrow. Then, in a voice you could pour over waffle:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dance like a herd of cattle,  Miss Fairchild. You are a rare woman  who lights up the room... simply by  leaving it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bows. As he rises, the reflection of Leopold's UNCLE O a pampered, effectual man in his 60's, appears behind Leo in the looking glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me Leopold, do you plan to join  us downstairs after completing this  one-sided flash of wit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I despise affairs of this sort, Uncle  Otto. No one really listens to anyone  else. If you attempt it, you will  see why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You judge everything too severely. I  wonder what would happen if you were  to cast that critical eye inward?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do not wonder at all. You merely  ask in order to state your own  opinion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are all concerned about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh, here it comes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your life does not seem to have any  direction. At the age of 25 a man is  too young to do anything well. At 35  he is too old. Now is your time to  take action. Tell me, what is it you  want to DO with your life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wearily) I do not know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (just as weary) Your ignorance cramps my conversation. (he slaps Leopold's  face twice rather  quickly) Wake up! This is your one and only  life. Every man has the chance to  make a difference. DO something!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold, stung, takes a moment to compose himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am most grateful for your  surveillance and for your sympathy.  I assure you there is no need for  concern. I am as effectual and  attentive... as my position allows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life is not position, Leopold. It is  action. (he straightens  Leopold's tie) I will see you downstairs promptly.  In the appropriate frame of mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves. Leopold stares into the mirror, snaps his fing The valet hands him a glass and pours a small shot of bra Leopold shoots him a look. The valet fills the glass high Leopold drains the glass and heads to the doorway. He  hesitates, taking a deep breath and a long pause. Finally

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grandly) Go spread joy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without looking back, Leopold leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music fills the air as the creme de la creme of Victorian society gather inside. Leopold holds a prearranged dance  card. He looks at the names and finds his first partner i MISS TREE. Leopold looks upward helplessly at an unrelent God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A profoundly self-conscious Leopold dances energetically  into frame with MISS TREE, an ancient, elfin, yet amazing SPRY woman who gapes up at him searchingly, unblinking. Leopold opens his mouth to speak, can think of nothing  suitable to say, and clamps his mouth shut. They dance ou of frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold dances into frame with CLARA, a BEAUTIFUL girl of 19. He glances at her and smiles. She titters, turning aw shyly. They whirl around the dance floor. His smile grows into a broad grin. Caught up in the excitement, Clara bea up at him... happily revealing a mouth full of missing, i teeth. Leopold, face frozen in a formal smile, dances on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold lumbers into frame with MISS FAIRCHILD, a woman o immense girth. With great dignity and extreme difficulty maneuvers her around the floor, looking everywhere except her enormous bosom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dance like an angel, Miss  Fairchild. You light up the room. I  thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Fairchild curtseys heavily. Leopold glances at his c sees the name Miss Serena Clacket and shudders. He spots a VERY LOVELY WOMAN hidden amongst the guests. S scribbles in a small note pad, occasionally glancing arou Hiding his dance card, he saunters over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening. I do not believe I  have had the pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young woman stares vacantly at Leopold until she real he is addressing her. She puts her pad away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Julia Carlson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold takes her hand and kisses it gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Will you excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slightly tipsy) You are not from the area, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles and shakes  her head "No") Are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my estate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? (looking around the  room) Well it's not home but it's much...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold regards her curiously. The orchestra starts up. T is a hubbub amongst the guests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shocking! The TA-RA-RA-BOOM-DE-AY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The? Oh, that's from Paris, isn't  it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a scandal nonetheless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold spots Uncle Otto observing him from across the ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Carlson, do me the honor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid I'm not much of a dancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling seductively) Truly I would be in your debt. Any  admonition would be erased simply by  presenting a partner as lovely as  yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no. Really, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold stiffly holds out his arm. A beat. Carlson, stuck takes it WITH HESITATION and is escorted to the dance flo They dance. ALL but Leopold and Carlson gaily sing "TA-RA BOOM-DE-AY." Leopold, flushed, looks quite smitten. Carls shy at first, eventually smiles brightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose we really ought to sing  along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) Oh, golly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They half sing, half speak the TA-RA-RA-BOOM-DE-AY, their emphasis on "BOOM." Laughing giddily, their dancing becom freer, picking up speed. The room SPINS. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathless) Thank you for the dance. It was  lovely. I hope it wasn't too awful  for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all. It was most enlightening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a slight pause. The Grandfather CLOCK strikes  midnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really must be going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't hear of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving away from him) No, I'm quite late as it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shall see you to the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopping him  resolutely) You're very sweet. I had a wonderful  time. (she watches him,  memorizing his face.  Then firmly) Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold takes a glass of champagne from a passing waiter. watches Carlson pass through the crowd and out the courty door. He surveys the room. After a moment he follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold makes his way through the manicured garden in the dark. He hears an EERIE METALLIC SOUND. He slows down, br back the thicket. The silhouette of a woman is revealed. is once again writing in her notebook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Carlson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlson spins around quickly, panicked. Leopold STOPS.  Partially hidden in the brush, a sleek, oddly shaped,  MECHANICAL device. It's door open, lit from within, casti a weird glow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you...? You frightened me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold moves toward the contraption and is about to touc it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What sort of mechanism is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlson shakes her head, unsure of how to proceed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's perfectly all right. It's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold carefully examines the apparatus, stepping inside Carlson FREEZES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (carefully,  deliberately) Listen to me. Please. Move very  slowly. Step out of the machine.  Step out and I'll explain whatever  you want to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this? Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His hand comes to rest on a glowing red lever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She YANKS on his arm. Instinctively he pulls away,  accidentally thrusting the lever into action. Carlson fal from the machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly frantic) Get out of there! Get out now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The machine LIGHTS UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Carlson... I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The compartment door snaps shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a BRIGHT WHITE FLASH. Blackness fills the screen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The compartment door slides OPEN revealing DR. KAU, 30's, Asian doctor with a THICK BROOKLYN ACCENT. Her face full enthusiasm drops as she sees the unconscious Leopold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to her co-workers, warning them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks back at Leopold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her co-workers, DR. PLODDER, austere, authoritative, DR.  DRAKE, muddled and timid, peer inside the compartment doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody stay calm... Lock the front  door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Drake and Kau make a move to inspect an unconscious  Leopold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no. You mustn't touch him.  The consequences could be  catastrophic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He could be hurt, or even dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...All right. Touch him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They approach Leopold. Dr. Kau finds Carlson's note pad o the ground next to Leopold. She reads the last entry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...But I'm stuck and it's only a  dance and he IS the seventh Duke of  Albany...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all look at one another, then back at Leopold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlson...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (racing from the room) Give me a minute...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATHERINE COLES, a radiant workaholic, types frenetically into the computer while talking on the phone, trying hard not to sound upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's upset? People fall in love,  they have to climb back out. (she laughs but she  is not smiling) So, what? We'll just be friends now,  Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops typing and listens for a while. She runs her ha through her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see. Well I appreciate your honesty. (using her middle  finger she pushes up  her glasses) No. I'll just think of this as  surviving another dating accident.  Take care or good luck or whatever  I'm supposed to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The line goes dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...say... Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Plodder bursts in. Kate sees his distress and instant becomes very centered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising) That's impossible! She wasn't supposed  to return until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate. It's Carlson. Something went  wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands her Carlson's note pad. Slowly, she sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...The 7th Duke...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (all business, reading  from a printout) ...of Albany. He was the... IS the  son of Emery and Eliza. He was of no  actual importance until he vanished  at the turn of the century without a  trace. It was a sensation. In the  30's they even made a movie about  him. "The Tenuous Duke" with Ronald  Coleman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (absently) I love Ronald Coleman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Despite much speculation and a nation  wide investigation, a body was never  found. He was never heard from again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a stunned silence. They stare at Leopold in awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've altered the course of history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We never should have started this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we going to do? We can't  keep him here. Imagine if anyone  found out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think. Just, think. Rationally. Now,  no one would believe such a stupid  mistake could be made because no one  would believe any of this is possible.  So. We fix this. We keep this to  ourselves and we fix it. Fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all nod in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Kau, research all our data. 1st  priority: Locate Carlson. Drake,  determine the reciprocal correlation's  connected to the 19th century. Work  24 hours a day if necessary. In the  meantime... one of us will have to  take charge of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She forces back panic. Only the tremor in her voice gives her away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a major scientific  opportunity. It doesn't get any better  than this. Imagine. Researching the  behavior, the physical and emotional  characteristics of a century ago!  Utilizing technology available to us  today... He's a gold mine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a man, Kate. Not a guinea pig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And while he's here, he's ours. Any  volunteers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll draw names. Whoever is is picked  will be responsible. Agreed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They nod reluctantly. Drake writes out names and throws t in a cup. The silence becomes deafening. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the scientists face her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll look after him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I meant I'll pick the name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches in. They wait with mounting suspense. Finally SHE TURNS TO KATE. The scientists follow her gaze. A beat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold stirs. He blinks at the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where...? What has happened?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctors, caught off guard, SMILE BENIGNLY. They surro Leopold as a group, not knowing where to begin. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Grace... Um... Hello... Weee  aaare a smaaall part of a laaarge  research team. A project funded by  the government of the United States.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (regarding their  appearance with  distaste) Oh. Americans. I see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, um... For the past six and a  half years we've been conducting  scientific experiments on density  and flexibility in the dimensions of  time and space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, uh... Quite by accident we came  upon a formula utilizing Tachyons...  particles traveling faster than the  speed of light, which allowed us  to... fold time so to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Bend it between the cracks of  the dimensions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all laugh nervously. Leopold does not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, while that wasn't the original  purpose of our experiment, we opted  to pursue it, well, privately, on  our own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borrowing funds already provided.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We journeyed to your time because it  was the quickest path to follow. We  debated long and hard whether we  should use this knowledge at all.  Believe me, it was never our intent  to disturb the past...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merely to discover if the expedition  were possible. As your presence here  confirms... we are very disturbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold nods at them as if they are insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The problem facing us is not only  HOW to get you back, but WHEN, you  see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We certainly don't want to  miscalculate. Send you to a different  era entirely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold starts to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rest assured, no harm will come to  you. You'll be well looked after by  Dr. Coles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Coles...? I do not follow. What  do you mean, get me back home?...  Where am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awkward pause. Leopold looks carefully around the room fo the first time: modern mechanical equipment, data shiftin and changing, giant cooling devices, bright neon lighting The doctors are silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer me!... (slowly) Would you have me believe... I am  being detained, at present in the  HEREAFTER?... The time to come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (carefully) It is the year nineteen hundred and  ninety-five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold leaps up. The doctors follow him around the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're insane! All of you! This is  impossible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold, calm down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A voyage through time! What do you  take me for? Did you bring me here  by force?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're scientist, not seditionists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (truly panicked) Let me out of here! I won't stand  for this another moment!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold moves quickly, fearfully through the darkly lit  hallway, the doctors close behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold, wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know what you're doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just listen to what we have to say!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is too late. Leopold throws open the door and runs  upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blinding sunlight. Skyscrapers. Automobiles. Traffic ligh Road construction. Modern day pedestrians. Helicopters. C alarms. Leopold stands frozen, overwhelmed, taking it all in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctors reach him. He collapses to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Dr. Kau talk quietly. Leopold, tightly holding o his seat and the back door, gazes out the window in utter disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squab?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember reading they ate a lot of  squab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squab... Do you have a squab?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly. On the verge  of panic) I don't know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull yourself together! (turning to Leopold) Are you all right back there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold, trembling, gapes at the sights, every day sounds magnified. Perspiration runs down the side of his face. K watches him in her rear view mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to be fine you know.  There's nothing to worry about. I  have everything under control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Kau stares at Kate in concerned silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly to Dr. Kau) We'll never get away with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold awakens alone in his room. He sits up with a jolt His stomach sinks as he realizes THIS IS NO DREAM. He slo rises to his full stature, moving to the window he looks on the modern day city, shaking his head in awe. He makes his way to the bedroom door and tentatively touches the k There is a KNOCK on the door. Leopold JUMPS back and runs to the bed: The picture of  dignity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you feeling? (no response) I thought you might like some tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I insist on being returned home  immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand. We're doing our best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish to speak with your employer,  Dr. Coles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're speaking to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are not suggesting that you are  Dr. Coles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss... uh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Coles. If you like, you could  call me Miss Dr. Coles or if that's  too much, how about just plain Kate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coldly) A WOMAN of science?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard to believe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But a woman's brain cannot obtain  enough knowledge to posses a truly  scientific mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jotting this down) Interesting. Nevertheless, we've  come a long way baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) Are you attempting to be humorous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm attempting to be informative  it's just coming out humorous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold regards her dubiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clinically) Look, modern social science clearly  states that a woman's place in society  marks the level of that civilization.  A science career for a woman is now  almost as acceptable as being a...  a... waitress. Cream and sugar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young lady, I... Surely it is not  expected that I remain here with you  indefinitely... Unchaperoned?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pen poised) Does that make you nervous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (writing) Then what are you getting so red  about? It's a very large apartment...  with locks on all the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The idea! My dear Miss Coles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Coles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she puts the pad  down) Let's get one thing straight right  now. My name is Kate or Katherine or  if you insist Dr. Coles. (she rises) Take a good long look, Leopold. I am  a 20th century American woman with a  Doctorate and a commission and  independence. I am not your "young  lady" or your "pretty Miss" or your  "honey." Is that clear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold watches her with great interest. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey... For the tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'll get it for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate grabs the teacup grandly and leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate rummages through every drawer, shelf and cupboard  searching for the honey. Finally, she spots the honeybear and squeezes honey A TAD TO VIOLENTLY into the tea. She t posing "confidently" then checks her reflection in the  toaster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate returns "confidently" with the tea and a plastic smi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you... Has it been decided  what it is I am to do while I am  being held here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, just some laundry, the cooking,  a little light housework...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold doesn't react.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clearing her throat) I took the liberty of preparing a  simple schedule to efficiently utilize  your time while incorporating you  into my routine. (she hands him a  schedule) As you can see, my day begins with  meditation and yoga from 6:30 to  7:00.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves in close to him, making Leopold uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU will arise at 6:45, shower and  change and at 7:15, we breakfast  together. 7:45 we begin the days  work. At 10:45 Dr. Kau arrives to  observe you in your natural routine  as I research the data that will  enable you to return home. At 1:15  we lunch together. 2:15 you answer a  daily questionnaire, I type up my  notes. At precisely 6:15 you will  enjoy 15 minutes of FREE TIME, then,  at 6:30, I listen to Tom Brokaw while  making dinner as YOU write down any  questions that come up during your  day. At 7:00, we dine together. If  you need me at any time you may ring  this bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rings a tiny dinner bell. He is about to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Mondays and Wednesdays I have  computer science class, Tuesdays I  have therapy. IF I have a date, I'm  usually home by 9:15. During these  periods you may read any of the books  I've picked out for you in your room.  I organize my next days work at 10:30,  11:35, David Letterman, 12:40 I'm in  bed. (she takes a breath,  smiles at him) Next day we begin again. Simple?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat, with  great dignity) ...At what time shall I WEE and POOH?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate is forced into a stunned silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate? I'm home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Yes. Our chaperone is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sort of. My brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Visiting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the past two years. Charlie can  never know about this project. We'll  tell him you are a... overly  distinguished colleague staying here  as our guest. From Canada. Which  would explain your lack of familiarity  with our customs and so forth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aghast) A CANADIAN?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make yourself comfortable. I'll check  in on you later. I think this is  going very well, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold looks at her blankly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. If you need anything, just  ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate tinkles the bell, fumbles for the knob and heads out P.O.V. still on Leopold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) Charlie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming just as  loud) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still shouting) Come here I wanna talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold listens at the door. He slowly opens it, takes tw steps out, peers around the corner, then quickly steps ba in. He takes a DEEP FRIGHTENED BREATH and slowly deflates

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie sits on the couch smoking a cigarette surrounded his paintings. He is a likable twentysomething with a big mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (removing his coffee  from the table,  setting it on a  coaster) RINGS! And what did I say about you  smoking in the house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were against it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Correct. You're back early. (She takes away his  cigarette)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!... Are you all right? You look  funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny ha ha or funny odd?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That all depends. How was your trip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it was good I'll tell you the  truth. If it was rotten I'll have to  butter you up first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butter me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you been working out? No, I'm  really starting to see results. Are  you comfortable there on the couch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Cause you'll be sleeping there  the next few nights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to be out of here by 8 and  you can't be back before 6. We have  an important man working with us  with very unusual needs. The company  is insisting he stay here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about a hotel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This man requires around the clock  attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I meant for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Charlie. (she kisses his  forehead) I owe you one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You owe me nine. What am I supposed  to do all day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as if having an  epiphany) You could get a job!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate, the entire point of being an  artist is that I don't have to work.  Who is this guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I can't tell you much because...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not allowed to discuss what goes  on at the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I'm not. Anyway, it might be  interesting to have someone else to  talk to. It gets so quiet around  here sometimes I feel like I've gone  deaf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does he have a label?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEOPOLD? Is he anything like his  name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's exactly like his name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you owe me ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold PEEKS around the entrance to the living room.  Confident it's unoccupied, he majestically walks inside: to date gadgetry, Charlie's modern art work, bright  fashionable furniture. Leopold recoils. His eyes come to  rest on the television set. The ON OFF buttons loom large He looks around the room then brazenly presses the button ON. Instantly, REGIS and KATHY LEE loudly berate each other b an excited crowd. Leopold jumps back several feet, hands flailing in front him as if shooing away a bee. He quickly, yet cautiously, slams the power OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horrible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He quickly scurries out the hallway. He stops abruptly. He remains very still. Composing himse he turns and deliberately faces the room. After a moment, purposefully steps back inside. He makes a large ARC around the television set, is confro by one of Charlie's sculptures and makes an ARC around th He finds himself in front of a light switch and gingerly  examines it. As he does, track lighting ILLUMINATES the r He looks at the lights then back at the switch. He flicks the lights ON and OFF, trying to figure out the precise m in the transfer of power, laughing in spite of himself. Kate and Charlie enter. They watch Leopold flicking the  lights, laughing like a madman. Charlie gives Kate a look

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (explaining) He's from Canada...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold sits at the head of the table, Kate and Charlie  banished to either side. Leopold chews his dinner incessa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally) What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called Hamburger Helper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is beyond help. Please serve the  next course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes his plate away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid there is no next course.  If you make a list of the foods you  like, I'll pick them up at the store  for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is all food here this... textured?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please understand, I am used to a  different sort of preparation. Where  I come from a proper meal is the  result of reflection and study. A  recipe is merely a theme which an  intelligent cook can plan each time  with variation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie gives Kate a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several courses are served. Menus  are often prepared days in advance,  timed to perfection. It is said,  without the culinary art, the  crudeness of reality would make life  unbearable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Canada?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat. Firmly) In Canada.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a saying here. "Shake and  shake the catsup bottle, none will  come and then a lot'll."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pours catsup on his dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How interesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since you're such an expert on fine  cuisine, why don't you make dinner  tomorrow night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It should be obvious to you that I  am NOT a domestic. You may take my  plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have my own, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who died and made me Cinderella?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young man, there is a distinct  impertinence to your voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's part of my charm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suppress it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (changing the subject) Leopold... Since you're our guest  here, there are several cultural  events you might enjoy seeing. Charlie  has season tickets to the ball game.  Perhaps you'd like to take that in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or the Opera or the Ballet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, there's no rule that says  everyone has to be interested in  baseball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but I believe there is a rule  that says everyone has to have HEARD  of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Coles, your brother Charles  attitude and demeanor are  unacceptable. If I am to stay on  here you must have a serious talk  with him regarding respect and  civility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLES, could you help me with the  dessert in the kitchen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the kitchen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN the kitchen. Excuse us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Charlie leave. The camera remains on Leopold, si alone, calmly sipping his wine. VOICE OVER FROM THE KITCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe this guy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to be nice to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm always NICE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please Charlie, as a favor to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives me the creeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold reacts. He listens self-consciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's different that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that crack about domestics?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, this is important to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going out with him, are  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eeuuu! I may be desperate but I'm  not a lost cause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate, this is me. I've seen the guys  you bring home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've done countless favors for you!  Now I'm asking for just one little  thing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Oh, all right! All right! All right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They emerge from the kitchen, beaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) We forgot the dessert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know,... I don't know if I  mentioned it... but that is one fine  looking suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Radio alarm clock -- 7:45 a.m. Louis Armstrong begins to  sing, "Let's Call the Whole Thing Off." Dressed in yoga  clothes Kate sits on her bed in the lotus position. She b the gong and closes her eyes. A bell rings. Kate flinches but does not open her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (too sweetly) What is it, Leopold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bell rings louder, interrupting Kate's routine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes closed, screaming  like a fishwife) WHAT IS IT, LEOPOLD?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold's bell rings with determination. Kate is off the and out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate enters and stops short. Leopold sits at the table ri a BELL. The dishwasher is open and SPRAYING WILDLY, the  blender has spread breakfast shake EVERYWHERE, water is  BOILING OVER on the stove, refrigerator, freezer, and eve cupboard door is OPEN. Garbage disposal runs FULL BLAST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly amidst the  chaos) I cannot seem to find the tea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE UP: Leopold's hand rings a bell with irritation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold, Kate, and Charlie stand in front of Charlie's op closet. Leopold selects clothes from Charlie's wardrobe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... No... No. Good God, no!...  Perhaps...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses them aside carelessly as Charlie seethes. CLOSE UP: Leopold rings his bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Charlie form a line to the bathroom. Kate checks her schedule and bangs on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold, your time is up! What's he  got, a girl in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold Luxuriates in the bathtub wearing a "Whitecap"  marveling at the whirlpool and the instant hot water. He  picks up a can of shaving cream and inspects it in wonder It SPRAYS. CLOSE UP: Leopold rings his bell. Nothing happens. He  discovers the clapper has been stolen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate types, talks and researches simultaneously. She look up and stops suddenly. Leopold appears wearing MANY oddly assorted layers of  Charlie's clothes, a bandanna bow tie, Irish woolen cap,  bicycle gloves, aluminum baseball bat walking stick. He p foppishly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should like to read about modern  currency during my bath tonight. See  that the tub and basin are scrubbed  up. Remnants remain of this afternoons  shave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate nods at him stupefied. Due to the many layers of  clothing, he imperiously leaves the room walking as if we skis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold rings a BIG NEW COWBELL. No one responds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He discovers Kate at her computer, Charlie reading a book Each are wearing a walkman. He stands in front of them and rings his cowbell furiousl until they look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold studies his questionnaire, Kate researches Victor customs. They simultaneously look up and gaze at the othe A beat. Embarrassed, Kate dons her glasses and Leopold shuffles  papers. They look up again. Then down. Then get back to w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate sits on her bed with her laptop watching David Lette She glances up, laughs out loud. She looks at the dark em room. No one is there to share it with. Closing her compu she holds her pillow close to her. She slowly moves to th window and looks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A text book with Leopold's picture inside. Leopold reads brief summary of his life with heartbreaking astonishment He moves to the window and looks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Leopold gaze out of their windows. The camera sl pulls back until they are swallowed up by the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate scans her notes as Leopold paces dully about the roo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In our last session you intimated  there was a symmetrical system  regulating the social order of  conformity spanning your era. I found  this particularly intriguing If I  can just find it in my notes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fire engine races by. Leopold dashes to the window then turns back, excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire brigade!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate stares at him blankly. She munches RICE CAKES and dr water FROM THE BOTTLE. A beat. She returns to her notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is insufferable! I refuse to be  spied upon, skipped over, or shuffled  about any longer. I have yet to  venture outside this cell. Before I  go mad a more suitable arrangement  must be found.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Found it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled) A resolution?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I meant I found my notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Coles! Changes are in order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can hear you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under control now) Miss Coles, as we are to remain here  together, there are certain conditions  I insist are met and maintained. I  no longer wish to be peeped at,  mocked...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly) Or interrupted. Jot this down.  Breakfast at 12. Luncheon at 4. Diner  at 8. A horse should be made available  from 1 to 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A horse? In New York City?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Also, I feel very strongly about  your style of dress. I do not care  for it. (Kate looks up) I cannot believe it is the prevailing  taste for women to appear masculine  and unkempt. If this is the fashion,  have it altered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is all for the present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grandly hands her a napkin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRUMBS, my dear!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (infuriated) Thank you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brushing herself off, she heads to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Coles. I have been acquainted  with many women in my time, yet I am  compelled to say that the modern  woman is by far the least attractive  I have ever encountered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising to the occasion) And I have a news flash of my own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sir, are no Ronald Coleman!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She storms out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Drake enters Dr. Kau's office with two pints of Haage Dazs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chocolate Peanut Butter Cookie Dough  Swirl or Peach?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They dig in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any luck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yea. Lots of luck. All bad. No  information exists detailing what  happened to Carlson. I've been working  for weeks and I'm not any closer  than when I began... How are you  doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My cholesterol level is up 70 points.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate enters, exhausted, deposits an armful of papers on D Drake's desk. Kate has pencils tucked behind her ear, thr her hair, and in her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Kate... How're you managing  with Leopold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Fine... Why? What did you hear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. I was just asking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Well, it's fine. He's a delight.  Everything's under control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep up the good work. (after she's gone) She seemed a little scattered. Do  you think everything's all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katherine Coles is the most capable  person we have on this project. If  anyone can handle the delicacy of  this situation, Kate can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So there's nothing to worry about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GONE? GONE WHERE?! (Charlie shrugs) Charlie we've got to find him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (working on a VERY  STERN portrait of  Kate at her computer) Are you crazy? This is the first  time all week my eyes aren't darting  to the top of my sockets every five  minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did he leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. An hour ago? He said  he wanted to take a walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you let him?? He's not allowed  to go outside!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he being punished?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to find him! You stay here  in case he finds his way back. And  while you wait you'd better pray  he's all right. If anything happens  to him, anything at all, EVERYTHING  we've worked for will have been  destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She heads out the door. Charlie follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate, calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And YOU'LL be responsible. Understand? (she grabs her coat  and purse)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the big deal? Who is this  guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate takes a LONG pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold... is not really from Canada.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peaceful. The sun sets. Pigeons rest on window sills.  Suddenly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OH MY GOD!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pigeons take flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold leaves Central Park profoundly lost. Looking both ways in the wrong direction, he crosses the street. SCREE brakes, HONKING horns, FURIOUS shouts with Leopold, horri caught in the middle. He makes it across shaking and daze A motorist pulls along side of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stupid fucking son of a bitch.  Next time I'll hit ya. Fucking moron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold GAPES, appalled. A Hansom carriage slowly treads  into Central Park. Leopold watches until it disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate drives slowly, searching for Leopold. Cars honk with mounting anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're ya waiting for lady? An  invitation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry! I'm sorry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She continues searching, trying hard to remain calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huge buildings. Neon lights flashing. Garbage in bundles. Calvin Klein Ads. In the center of it all, Leopold, jostl BADLY by the crowd, tipping his hat to all the ladies. He enters a deli.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold, appalled by the prices searches for money. He ha none.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the counter man) $7.95 for a sandwich? Is that correct?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta problem with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems rather pricey to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So don't buy one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shan't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So shan't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I... I would be happy to sample  one however I'm afraid I haven't the  finance with me just now. If I could  establish a credit with you, I will  have someone come round with the  funds tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will gladly pay me Tuesday for a  hamburger today, is that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little confused) I believe so. Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the fuck outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out. Fuckin' Wimpys piss me off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I remind you, merchant, that I  am the customer in this establishment  and as such require your attention  and the utmost respect. I do not  accept this modern convention of  desecrating one's patrons with such  contemptuous disregard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need I add that without our patronage  you would not own that unwashed  counter behind which you spew your  filthy mouth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you get off? You don't even  have any money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be irrelevant... I'm browsing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not in my store you're not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes out from behind the counter. He's big.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very superior) Do you intend to physically escort  me out...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold is thrown out of the store and on to the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see what he did? Did you see  that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one responds. Leopold is left sprawled on the street.  Thunder is heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gargoyles at New York City Library, The Dakota, the Bower Alphabet City. EXT. CLAIRMOUNT STABLES - 4 A.M. Pouring rain. Leopold stands in front of the stables beat and drenched. A car drives by, screeches to a stop, and  hastily backs up along side Leopold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold! Leopold, get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold stares at the car. Kate runs out, opens the door helps him in. She dashes back into the drivers seat. INT. CAR - 4 A.M.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nearly in tears,  trying to dry him  off) Leopold! Oh, Leopold thank God you're  all right. I didn't think I'd ever  find you. You had us all so worried.  Oh, Leopold!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hits him hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you ever go out again without  my permission, do you hear me? I was  frantic. You could have been killed  a hundred times over. I never would  have known.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rests her head on the steering wheel, exhausted. She  pulls herself together and looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold, are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking deep into  her eyes for the  first time) I wish to go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I'll get you home in a jiffy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (badly shaken) No... I wish to go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate gently observes Leopold who stares rigidly straight  ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) I don't know. It's just Leopold.  Like Cher. Or Goofy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Leopold walk in wet and exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind they just walked in. Jesus.  You look horrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, don't start. I haven't been  this angry at you since you got me  into that pyramid thing last year.  If you make a wisecrack I'm going to  burst into flame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't a wisecrack. You do look  horrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm too tired for this now. I'll  just save it up and kill you tomorrow.  Help Leopold out of his things and  lets get him to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've something to say. To the both  of you. I... Nothing is what it seems.  After witnessing mere weeks of this  age it is painfully apparent I am  outside of my acquaintance... I don't  know how to proceed. I frankly... am  in need of assistance. I'm sorry.  I'm not very good at this. In the  event you have missed it, I am  apologizing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a long pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About time. (he shakes Leopold's  hand reluctantly) Welcome back. (he leaves)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't mind him. His heart would be  in the right place if he had a heart.  Surliness runs in my family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand. It practically races  through mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked) Leopold, you made a joke. I mean one  that's not at my expense. That's  good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other just a second too long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd better get to bed... That is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... I start work... (she looks at her  watch) in three and a half hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They self-consciously head to their respective rooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine. I'm used to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mustn't get too used to it. You'll  find life passes you by awfully  quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate is struck by his vulnerability for the first time an is moved. She catches herself quickly however.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving it away) Oh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand at their bedroom doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, goodnight then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold?... I don't have a clear  handle on this. Perhaps I was wrong  keeping you confined to the apartment  all this time. I don't know when  you'll be able return home... Tomorrow  I'll start preparing you for the  outside world. And... We'll find  your way back. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold smiles, still shaken. A beat. They slowly close t doors to their respective rooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold, dressed for an outing knocks on Kate's bedroom d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold enters. Kate stands in a slip calmly looking at  Leopold. Leopold immediately turns, facing the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! I beg your pardon. I, I, I, was  merely... I didn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there something you want, Leopold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I merely wanted to see... that is,  inquire, on your availability, for  an outing... My assimilation and so  forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we have a lot of work ahead of  us. I'll be out in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, of course. Splendid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches around behind his back and fumbles for the kno He finally finds it and goes out. Kate smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the Brooklyn Bridge, the Chrysler Building, Rockefeller  Center, 5th Avenue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Leopold exit The Gap. Leopold awkwardly wears hi Gap casual clothes, a baseball cap on his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you certain this is correct?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate places the cap backwards on his head. She nods  approvingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly I'm certain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold watches himself in store windows. He CAN'T compre it. Kate leads him into Barney's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold stands before the mirror wearing a classic dark s He looks FANTASTIC. A fact that is not lost on Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now really. Isn't this better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate nods back begrudgingly, her breath taken away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lincoln Center, Columbus Circle, Gristedes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate selects a shopping cart, begins to push it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate walks ahead. Leopold, maneuvering a cart with a brok wheel, hasn't the knack and bangs into everyone and every in the aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Oops! Careful there. So sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE UPS: Leopold scrutinizing vegetables in cans, cerea for kids, bottled water, instant soup, feminine hygiene  supplies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The check out line. As their groceries are being rung up, Leopold spots The Sun, a newspaper with the headline: Wom Sees Satan in her Microwave Oven. Leopold eagerly shows K

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen today's paper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold reads the paper totally enthralled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Leopold walk down the street, a bag in each arm. Leopold eyes Kate suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Coles, why is it you are not  married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Women are longer defined by the men  they're married to, Leopold. I have  a career. I haven't found a man who  fits in with that yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yet people still marry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensively) I've heard of cases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue to walk, Leopold noticeably studies Kate.  Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suspect there is something wrong  with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing wrong with me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps it is the way you present  yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking  about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is some sort of problem when a  woman reaches thirty and insists on  remaining single.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'm THIRTY?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I look THIRTY to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was an arbitrary number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You chose it specifically opposed to  a lower number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Thirty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I apologize... How old are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharply) I'm thirty! But you're the first  person whoever told me I looked it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold spots a formal dress in a store window. He takes good long look at Kate, smiles, then quickly walks inside Kate continues down the block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's not that I insist on  remaining single. Believe me. Everyone  dreams of finding somebody to share  their life with. To give someone all  the love they've been hoarding since  they were a kid. I'm no different.  But one has to be sensible. I have a  career and a life that's filled  with...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks around. Leopold is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts off down the street, stops, and enters ROBERTA an upscale boutique.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate races in. Leopold talks with a saleslady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I have to do? Put a leash  around your neck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the saleslady) She is the woman to whom I was  referring. You see the problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giving Kate the once  over) Yep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring down at her  clothes then back at  the two of them) What?... What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From behind the dressing room door, Kate shouts to the ot with irritation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is ridiculous. I don't have  time to... (she shrieks) Do you know what this dress costs?  Let's get this over with. I'm coming  out. Nobody laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate leaves the dressing room in a huff COMPLETELY UNAWAR that she is STUNNING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satisfied?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold and the saleslady stare at her with pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and looks at herself in the mirror. Leopold sta behind her, pulls back her hair, brushes away her bangs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a lovely face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even Kate cannot deny that she is lovely. She stares at  herself for a long while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) We'll take the dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They become aware of their close proximity. They nervousl part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate sits Leopold down on the sofa. She turns on the TV a hands him the remote control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drug of the 20th century.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She aims the remote at the TV, changing channels. He's  spellbound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner is served. Kate waits patiently for Leopold who si on the sofa watching the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold, your dinner's getting cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does not move a muscle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Leopold sit on the sofa eating their dinner and  watching TV. On the screen, a Looney Tune. Leopold enjoys this especially. Kate reaches for the remote but Leopold  grabs it territorially, refusing to relinquish it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (making notes) It's a guy thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold asleep on the sofa still clutching the remote con Kate comes in with a blanket and settles it over Leopold. She glances around the room, then slowly bends down close capture a better look at his face. After a moment she catches herself, takes herself in hand and sits down at her computer. She opens her notes and ty Her fingers slow down to a crawl and come to a stop. She  looks up at Leopold lost in thought. She smiles. Reaching for a soda, she accidentally knocks a picture to the floor. In a SMASHED frame, Kate and CARLSON drunkenly mug for the camera. Kate pales noticeably. She looks from the picture to Leopold. Slowly, she begins pecking away at the keys. She does not look up again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate gives Leopold a tour of the lab stopping by Dr. Drak area. Hidden behind chalk boards, calculator paper, and  several empty Haagen Dazs containers, Dr. Drake searches solutions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Now within that astronomical  structure, Dr. Drake here is searching  for a pathway between your time and  the present. He'll find it too if  his arteries don't harden first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Astounding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once that is discovered, the search  begins for the exact time and date  travel will be possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move to Dr. Kau's area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dr. Kau) How are you proceeding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Kau merely grunts. Leopold looks at Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't take it personally. Once Dr.  Kau starts working, you just have to  wait until her batteries run down.  We're all pretty much like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They head into Kate's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate gathers her belongings, Leopold snoops at her notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The complexity of this equation is  astonishing? Can you really comprehend  all that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (simply. Almost  apologetically) I'm a genius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're quite exceptional Dr. Coles. (a beat) That is to say, you all are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. And may I say that  sometimes, in DIM light, you're not  so bad yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand together, Leopold grinning sheepishly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God! Is that the time? I'm  late. Therapy. Every Tuesday night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I accompany you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mayn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not certain I understand therapy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one does. That's why therapists  can charge so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she gathers her belongings, Leopold spots a very high  heeled red shoe in Kate's bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What exactly transpires during  therapy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold. A gentleman does not ask  those questions. Come on, we'll get  you home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am perfectly able to travel homeward  myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate looks at him skeptically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really! I have finance and our  address. I shall take a cabbie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are late. I insist. I am NOT a  child. Dr. Coles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Don't bite my head off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head and walks out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate heads down the stairs of a subway station. A few fee behind, Leopold cautiously follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate waits in line at the turnstile. Leopold, a ways back grimaces noticeably at the smell. Kate heads through. Leopold follows banging painfully int the bar. A NUN hurriedly bumps into him from behind. He tries pushing the bar but it doesn't budge. He turns a to step out of line but it is already too long. He stands NOSE to NOSE with the nun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't seem to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatiently) Oh, for heaven's sake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nun deposits her token and SQUEEZES them both through the train arrives at a deafening pitch, startling Leopold He spots Kate entering the train and jumps into the car i the nick of time. The train departs, Leopold pressed awkw against the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate races from the subway station, entering the Arthur M Dance Studio. Leopold, thoroughly disheveled, follows at distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elderly Blue haired couples chat amongst themselves, men the right, women on the left. Kate, in dance clothes, out breath, stumbles in, making a b-line for the women's side

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was worried. I thought you weren't  going to make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling happily) Miss my lesson? This is the only  thing I have to look forward to all  week. Is that a new dress Mrs. Pincus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Pincus executes a fancy spin, proudly showing off he purchase. Across the room, MR. Pincus beams in anticipati An elderly, overly made up dance instructor enters. She c her hands together loudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, kids. Pair up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men slick back their hair. The women straighten their gowns. Kate stands to the side, self-consciously studying the floor. The men take their places on the dance floor. They flick  their hand twice, inviting their women to dance. Cooly,  elegantly, the women approach their partners. After a whi Kate looks up, relieved. She stands alone. Ballroom music plays. The couples effortlessly shift between steps and turns. K dances with an imaginary partner, stumbling, more than a  beat behind, counting, animated, a concentrated YEARNING  look spread across her face. The instructor approaches with a look of resignation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't think so much, Katie. FEEL the  music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sweating) I am!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dancing should not be work. It should  be a vacation the body takes from  the mind. Let the music wash over  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frustrated) It is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Repeat after me: I've got the muusic  in me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got the muusic in me. INSTRUCTOR & KATE (overlapping) I've got the muusic in me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep telling yourself that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate does. Her instructor shakes her head and moves away. Across the room, through the window, Leopold watches, mov LEOPOLD'S P.O.V. -- Over the music, beyond the swirling  couples, Kate remains in the corner, dancing with her  imaginary partner, fighting valiantly for the right steps muttering to herself, dancing alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Kau SLAMS a large book on Dr. Plodder's desk startlin him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've located her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't! Is she all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. She's really not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Photograph of a SWEATSHOP 1896. The conditions are APPALL Positioned among the workers, Julia Carlson, thin, ragged worn out, stares helplessly into the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was taken a year after she arrived.  Look at her face! We have to get her  back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christine, this morning I spoke with  the head of funding. They're talking  about canceling the project.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! They can't do that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's still time. Nothing has  happened yet that can't be undone.  We'll get her back. We'll put this  behind us and we'll get her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctors stare at the photograph. Powerless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie and Leopold work at their easels. Leopold sighs  HEAVILY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there something on your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is rather difficult for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Uh huh...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
