dialogues.text: I have been in the salon contemplating  the reception I have received by the  various tradesmen I have visited.  I've determined I am lacking the  dexterity of modern intercourse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of what??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Social skills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I realize our association has been  rather distant and I bear you no ill  will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can imagine my relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fact is... I need help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not ask Kate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would appreciate the masculine  point of view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not ask Kate?... That was a joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold looks worried. Charlie puts down his brush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well? Let's see... I guess we could  start by removing that great big  stick from up your... Let's start  with your walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My walk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't walk right. (gently) You strut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very defensive) STRUT?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strut strut strut. You walk into the  bathroom it's like I'm watching a  parade. Walk across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you won't. You'll STRUT. You  asked for my help. Trust me on this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Leopold struts across the room Charlie shakes his head and spontaneously begins to hum Sousa's Stars and Stripes March. Leopold becomes more and more agitated. As the son crescendos:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough! Really! You walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie hops up, casually walks around the room and begin to hum a more relaxed version of Stars and Stripes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (between choruses) See? Easy. Relaxed. You try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold begins humming the more casual version of the son and mimics Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's better. Now, try to enjoy  your walk. It's a beautiful day. The  sun is shining, the peasants are  singing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VOICE OVER: Charlie and Leopold joyously singing The Star and Stripes. As the song builds: Charlie enters leading Leopold throughout the room. Leopo matches Charlie EXACTLY step by step so tightly they appe to be one person marching happily about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chinatown, Little Italy, chess in Washington Square Park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold and Charlie explore the city. Leopold works dilig on his walk. A beautiful woman walks by in a revealing ou Charlie catches Leopold watching her and smiles broadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interesting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold, caught leering, turns away sheepishly and smiles Charlie pats Leopold on the back. Stops. Pats his back ag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold, are you wearing a corset?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naturally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cracking up, Charlie good-naturedly puts an arm around  Leopold's shoulder. Leopold attempts the same pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a headset on, Charlie listens to music. Leopold watc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd ya say was the name of this  number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tchaikovsky. Waltz of the Flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadpan) Pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie stops the music and places a headset over Leopold ears. Leopold watches calmly. Charlie selects a song.  Instantly, Leopold's shoulders rise up to his ears. His m opens wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megadeath. High Speed Dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a bit, Charlie turns the music off. Leopold's shoul go down but his mouth stays wide open. Astonished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie and Leopold walk through the park. A rubber softb hits Leopold squarely on the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What in the world...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple race over. The man is BLACK. The woman is WHITE. Their child, ELIZABETH, 7, follows wide eyed and apprehen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry! We're so sorry. Are you hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's another Babe Ruth. We had no  idea. Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold regards them curiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you have to say for yourself,  Elizabeth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold stares hard at the modern familial scene. He does speak. After a long moment:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this your child?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie braces for the worst. The little girl stares at  Leopold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon honey, lets go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want my ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a moment! (bending down to  Elizabeth, firmly) Pick a hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks his right hand. Nothing. She picks his left.  Nothing. Leopold looks surprised then pulls the ball from his ear. She takes the ball and smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother's name was Elizabeth. (then to her parents) She's a beautiful child. You're very  lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you say, Elizabeth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth makes an embarrassed face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie and Leopold continue through the park, Leopold lo in thought. Charlie watches him in surprise. They walk on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold talks animatedly. On the table -- Pumpkin pies, p pies, and pot pies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand pumpkin pies, pizza  pies, and pot pies. But I wish someone  would explain Eskimo pies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He eats a large spoonful of pudding. Kate and Charlie exc a worried look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You smoke Camel's, you wear Old  Spices, and you drink Mountains Dew.  It's revolting. (to Kate) The pudding tonight is excellent.  Another thing I've noticed, everyone  is in a great rush today. Instant  Oatmeal, Instant Coffee, Speed Stick,  Minute Maid. You'll find there's  much to be said for moderation and  languor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He eats another spoonful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmm. Is it tapioca?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's margarine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking the spoon out  of his mouth) It's marvelous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. Work to do. Where are you  going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm meeting everyone over at Caffeine.  It's this coffee house we go to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say hello to Dennis for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dennis is this really good looking  friend of mine who doesn't know Kate's  alive because SHE doesn't know how  to flirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a rule I don't like to associate  with really good looking people. It  makes me feel really... I don't  know... Smart. But Dennis is a nice  guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he always picks up the check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds enjoyable. I shall join you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a wonderful idea! Leopold  mentioned how he wanted to meet...  People of quality was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhhhh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you'd rather I didn't go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nonsense! Charlie, you don't want to  hurt Leopold's feelings. He's going  to think you don't want him to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh it's not that. It's just that  it's sort of a vulgar crowd, is all.  I'm not sure you'd have such a good  time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little ribald humor? I'm not as  big a stick in the mud as you might  think! I'd enjoy a gay night out,  kicking up my heels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is an awkward pause. Leopold is so enthusiastic and sincere that despite a feeling of disaster Charlie relent

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finish off your Parquet and we'll  go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie gives Kate a look of death as we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie and Leopold approach Caffeine, a trendy coffee ho Charlie looks in the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There they all are. Now one more  thing. Throw the words "like" and  "you know" into a sentence whenever  possible. It's how people talk today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Proper speech does not cease to exist  simply because it is ignored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles, you needn't fret. I have  the walk down pat. I will not give  myself away. Like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking in the window) Oh shit! (correcting himself) Shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrice. See that girl? The blonde  one? She's so inconceivably hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrice, a tall blonde sits at a large round table, talki She is very beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's very pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok not exactly mine. But I saw her  first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I guess we should go in. I  don't suppose we could tell everyone  you don't speak English?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not. Let's go inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold walks his casual walk inside, followed by a very  reluctant Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie's friends are sitting at a table talking. They ar relaxed and friendly group. Charlie and Leopold approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ad lib greetings) Charlie! Where've you been? etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Uh everyone, this is my friend,  Leo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waz up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waz up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Leo's staying with us for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie pulls out a chair for Leopold but Leopold sits ne to Patrice instead. Patrice takes out her cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold takes a cigarette, lights one for Patrice, then h own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, my dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at a loss) Um?... (all look at Charlie) ...I have nothing to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did not tell the truth about  Patrice, Charles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLES??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I tell you, LEO?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He informed me you were inconceivably  HOT, but I think you're lovely.  Exceptionally lovely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Leo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the waitress) Check please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The subway car is inhabited solely by Leopold, Charlie, a the oldest Ukrainian woman in New York City. Despite the  fact that the train is empty, they are all seated on the  same bench. Charlie stares straight ahead refusing to even look at  Leopold. The Ukrainian woman hangs on every word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just drop it Leopold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Charles, it is so ridiculous. I  am not interested in her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In any case the problem is not with  me but with you. (quietly) You have no idea what it takes to go  about courting a woman. From what  I've witnessed tonight, it is  symptomatic of your entire generation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost speechless) You are some piece of work, Leopold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I do not wish to get personal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie bursts into ironic laughter and looks at the old  woman. She rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you have been of great assistance  to me and I feel this is one area  where I can be of some real help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fascinated. Go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, why was I successful with this  young lady and why did you so  miserably fail?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you think she likes you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well she gave me the number of her  telephone and I assumed it meant...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As I see it, the girl hasn't an  inkling of your intentions. And it's  no wonder. You, Charles, are a Merry  Andrew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Merry Andrew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything plays like a farce to  you. The more wit, the less courage.  I believe the modern woman desires  passion, protection, sensitivity. No  woman wants to be romanced by a  buffoon. (the old woman shakes  her head) Banter and repartee are fine but you  must add to that a different sort of  playfulness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I should pounce?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm saying you must treat her with  respect. Any oaf can attempt a crude  pass. A woman of Kate's stature would  never respond to an artificial tactic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you did. Didn't he say Kate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old woman nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are discussing your problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not anymore. You like my sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has trouble with men, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps she has not met the right  one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has met the right one. HUNDREDS  of times. But she pulls back. She  cuts herself off. You turn around  and suddenly you're dating a Sphinx.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One never can tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does Kate know how you feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you made your intentions known  to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the Merry Andrew now?! I think  you're all talk and no action. What  are you waiting for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not know if there is a future  in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well Leopold, no one ever does...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate enters with an arm load of Leopold's discarded cloth She drops them on his bed and begins to hang them in his  closet. A notebook falls from his pants pocket. She puts it on th bureau. A beat. She quickly picks it up, sits on the edge the bed and starts to read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading out loud) Royal family -- Uncouth. Making Out --  slow soulful kissing... Woman as  equals??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She flips a page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who drove the Chevy to the levy and  why was it dry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate smiles. She flips the page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyes shine when she talks about...  science. Raises her voice when she  knows she's wrong. BOSSY, BOSSY,  BOSSY. Lose my train of thought when  I see her smile. Most beautiful when  she's angry. Honorable heart...  Peasant feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door is heard slamming. Kate, alarmed, stuffs t notebook back in Leopold's pocket. She races to the door; glances back at the notebook, turns off the light and scu from the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The corridor is darkly lit. Kate leaves the bathroom as  Leopold enters. They collide and separate but remain clos together. Both are dressed in pajamas and speak softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooops. Bread and butter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bread and butter. It's an old  saying... Well not to you I guess.  You say it when you pass someone in  a cramped space. As close as bread  and butter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. Did you have a good time last  night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was very interesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you find that person of quality?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold looks at her a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... fine. (there is a pause) I guess it's time to turn in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches her door. Leopold stops her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns. Leopold grasps for the words but the habit of  inaction returns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight. (he slowly closes the  door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie stands at Patrice's door with a large painting. H looks over at Leopold hiding the next doorway over. Charl knocks. She opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I brought you some flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands her the flower filled painting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Wochuchowski? I was wondering  if you would do me the great honor  of accompanying me to the cinema  tonight. And allowing me the privilege  of escorting you to dinner afterwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrice shyly studies the painting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie quickly looks at Leopold pleadingly. He really do not want to say this next part. Leopold, however, is adam

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadpan) Gracing me with your conversation  and company would mean the world to  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a long pause. Patrice watches Charlie in disbeli

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 7:00 is fine. I'll call for you then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They smile at each other for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (silently mouthing) Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye. (she closes the door) It worked!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course it did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold, I... I'm... I have no idea  what to do next!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles. Leave everything to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so fast, buddy. You're next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate is by the bookshelf gathering reference books on tim and space. Leopold enters. He is suddenly embarrassed and doesn't know how to proceed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning. You're up early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves to her computer on the other side of the room.  Leopold follows. Before she can sit down, Leopold pulls o her chair. She falls to the ground. He rushes to her side immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm terribly sorry!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happens all the time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens a reference book and slowly begins typing at he computer. There is a pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Coles?... ah, Kate? I was  wondering...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops working and looks at Leopold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What it is you're working on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. It's my computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She resumes her work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see. Actually I meant the work  itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm researching the correlations  between your time and the present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold stares blankly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm TRYING to get you home, Leopold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie peaks in, signaling Leopold, spurring him on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have never seen a woman work as  diligently and extensively before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's made me the man I am today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's quite a beautiful day, have you  noticed? Perhaps you would permit  yourself some time off and grant me  the privilege of escorting you around  the city this fine Spring afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'd love to but I can't. I've  got too much work to do. Ask Charlie  though. He'll go with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid it really wouldn't be the  same. It is YOUR company I am seeking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprised, Kate turns around and looks at Leopold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently) Oh, Leopold. I'm so sorry. I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see. Some other time then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold sits at the far end of the room. Kate takes a mom then resumes typing. She STOPS and sits back in her chair After a long moment, she subtly unplugs the computer with her foot and starts banging on the top of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh for crying out loud. Would you  look at this? Leopold? The computer's  on the blink again. (she bangs harder) Cheap piece of equipment. I can't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe if you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO, no, it does this all the time.  Just have to wait it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Perhaps it is a sign?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you think? (she smiles at Leopold)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold trots his horse expertly along the horse path. Ka follows, clutching the horses neck, bouncing like a clown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I must have gotten a funny  horse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold turns and rides around Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bethesda fountain. Boats on Central Park Lake. Couples in Sheeps Meadow. Holding the reins of Kate's horse in one hand, Leopold gr Kate's waist with the other as they ride a single horse  through the greenery of Central Park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A revival house. On the Marquee: "The Tenuous Duke" starr Ronald Coleman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Leopold eat popcorn, Milk Duds, M & M's, and drinks. The lights go down and the movie begins. The enormity of the medium strikes Leopold at once. He  involuntarily leans back in his chair grabbing Kate's  shoulder, watching attentively. After a bit:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that supposed to be my hair? Do  you see how they think my hair looks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate looks over at Leopold and nods. Through his eyes, sh too experiences movies for the first time. She moves clos to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grammercy Park, The Guggenheim Museum, Central Park Plaza The Metropolitan Museum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Leopold bound up the steps, entering the museum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Modern art exhibit. Leopold stares blankly at an empty wh canvas. He turns to Kate questioningly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's simplicity in it's purest  form. It speaks volumes in it's  nothingness. Whiteness representing  emptiness. Hopelessness. It's bleak.  Bleak!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold eyes the painting skeptically. They move to the n object d'art. A toilet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaand this represents...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They burst into giddy laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They round the corner, moving to the next room. Leopold's smile fades. CLOSE UP: A painting of privileged Victorian society. Shaken, he gazes at a painting in a dream-like state.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very quietly) I'd almost forgotten how beautiful  it was. Truly. Beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate smiles sadly at Leopold. They slowly walk out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear keys in the lock and laughter outside as Kate and Leopold enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) M & M's, CBS, FBI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VIP, VHS, VCR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They collapse on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, JFK, PDQ, XYZ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. K.D. Lang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how you keep up with  it. I'm exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So am I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you what. Why don't I  prepare dinner tomorrow night? I  never have before. I mean even before  I hit town. "Hit town" How's that? I  can't imagine what it'll taste like,  but I don't think it will be any  worse than your cooking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold, I have a date tomorrow night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blind date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that just means I haven't met  him before. It was set up through  friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hazard of single life... I'm turning  in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate gets up. Leopold automatically stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another time then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's quite all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she gets to the door, she stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold? I had a wonderful time today.  I can't remember the last time I  took the day off and just played.  I'd forgotten how beautiful this  city can be... I want to thank you  for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pleasure was mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate smiles at Leopold and goes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, in a tie, is standing with Leopold at the dining room table. Kate wearing too much makeup for her date, ru into the bathroom in a BRIGHT RED DRESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a very fancy restaurant, Leopold.  Are you sure you can teach me  everything there is to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the bathroom) Just don't swipe the silverware and  give yourself away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's talking to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is very simple. I will be your  date. Just behave as you normally  would and I'll correct you along the  way. Now, escort me in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie and Leopold move across the room. After a beat,  Charlie magnanimously gestures for Leopold to go first.  Leopold gives his approval. Kate rushes out of the bathro in a tight BLACK dress. Leopold and Charlie elegantly walk to the table. Charlie  sits down, pleased. Leopold remains standing, incensed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold takes a cloth napkin, hits Charlie upside the hea Hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull the chair for a lady! Clod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No name calling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kate) Well, really!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie stands up and pulls out the chair. As Leopold sit Charlie pushes the chair in to hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not shoveling coal into a  furnace, Charles. Glide the chair in  gently. Gently. Try it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie gently glides Leopold to the table. He remains  standing, not sure what to do next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, sit down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now don't burst a vein or anything,  but there are quite a few knives and  forks here. How do I know what each  one's for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merely start from the outside and  work your way in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of beer should I order?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I WAS KIDDING!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold and Charlie stand. Kate poses in the gown picked by Leopold. Leopold smiles brightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look exquisite, Katherine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost sadly) Thank you, Leopold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Leopold not knowing what to say. Finally

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a tie I'm wearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look very nice, Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doorbell rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That must be him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your bland date?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blind date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember to breathe, Kate. And don't  use to many big words. You'll scare  the poor slob away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving to the door) This is always the scary part. (she sings) "Open the door to my, Mystery Date."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the door and looks straight up. Leopold and Cha peer in closer to get a better look. In the doorway stand LARRY, great looking, very tall, a winner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Kate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate turns back to the others with a frozen smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giving Larry the  once over) Kate, may I have a word with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. (as they cross the  room) I DON'T like the look of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cad. I can spot one a mile away. (he helps her with  her coat) I shall escort you out myself. I  will act as your chaperone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That isn't necessary. I'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is no trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight, Leopold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is gone. Leopold stares after her, dejected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Larry are led to their table. Larry sits down. K remains standing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (friendly) Sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs) Thank you. (she sits)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. How am I doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How am I doing? First date. You  pleased? You disappointed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Undecided.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He snaps his fingers to get the waiters attention startli Kate. She laughs nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. What did Jeannie say about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About you? Ah, she said you were  tall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And nice looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank her. And that you persevere  ardently on Wall Street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I work there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) That must be very interesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) You've obviously never worked on  Wall Street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing along for  the hell of it) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their laughter subsides. After a beat:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else did Jeannie say about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Maitre d' of this very fancy restaurant shows Charlie and Patrice to their seats. Charlie motions Patrice to go first just as Leopold has instructed. The Maitre de pulls out Patrice's chair. Charlie gives hi look to back off. Charlie effortlessly glides Patrice to table and takes his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have I told you how much I liked  your painting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beaming) Twice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you get tired of hearing about  it, let me know. I have to admit I  was sort of surprised when you called.  I didn't think you liked me, Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I first saw you, I thought... (he makes his jaw  drop down to the  floor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie smiles and places her hand over his heart. Then h makes his jaw drop again. Patrice laughs happily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Larry are eating their dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaand that's about all Jeannie said.  What did Jeannie say about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) She said you were enormously sexy,  had a great body, but you don't put  out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite a compelling portrait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning on the charm) Would you say it's an accurate  portrait?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaning into Larry) A masterpiece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold slowly carries a dinner tray to the dinning room  table. He moves to the window and looks out. After a whil he pours a glass of wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they eat their dinner Larry drones on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this guy wants to invest $50,000  in a stock that's no good. Here's  what I do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate stares absentmindedly at Larry, her mind somewhere e She looks down at the fork in her hand. She switches to t proper one, reflecting on Leopold's etiquette. She notice her napkin lying flat on the table. She reaches for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold unfolds his napkin and puts it on his lap. He beg to eat his dinner. Slowly. Elegantly. Alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate places the napkin on her lap. She stares at it a lon while. Finally she looks up at Larry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you the guy was a DICK!  A total ASSHOLE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jarred awake) Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff Murray. The guy I've been talking  about. Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing her feelings  for Leopold, smiling  radiantly at Larry) Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then as she leaves, a parting shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sound of keys in the lock, then Kate bursts through the d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The living room is dark and empty. She goes through the l room, past the hallway, into the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His bedroom is empty. He is not there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Leopold...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs into Charlie's studio and stops short. Next to Charlie's stern paintings, Leopold's portrait of  Kate shines in the moonlight. She wears an antique dress. She is lovely. Kate sees herself as Leopold sees her and touched. She turns and collides head on with Leopold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bread and butter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is wearing gloves and an apron. He rubs his bruised he inadvertently leaving a trail of suds along his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're back early. Did you enjoy  your date?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (happily) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves in close, trying to remove the soap from his fa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, you've got some...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wipes his face making it much worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it gone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She uses the apron to wipe away the soap. They gaze at ea other and become serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) A funny thing happened to me on my  bland date this evening, Leopold. I  really can't explain it. This puffed- up, puritanical, blundering, greenhorn  kept popping into my mind all night  long at the most inopportune times.  I couldn't get rid of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How inconsiderate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it was. The harder I tried,  the more persistent he became. He's  conceited and inflated and unseasoned  and it doesn't seem to matter...  He's 134 years old but I can't get  him out of my head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he there right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here. Larger than life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll protect you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss. A long romantic passionate kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Coles, would you grant me license  to dine with you tomorrow evening at  eight o'clock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Permission granted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until tomorrow, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They separate. A beat. Leopold gestures for Kate to go fi They head down the hallway together into their separate r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The table clock chimes eight times. Leopold enters from t kitchen dressed perfectly in the most UP TO DATE style. H carries a casserole dish. A second later Kate enters from the hallway. She is weari an OLD FASHIONED, ANTIQUE DRESS. She looks lovely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little startled) You look beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU do. What have you got there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold opens the casserole dish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hamburger Helper!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate smiles. She looks behind him into the kitchen. A COL MESS. Leopold lights the candles and pulls out her chair. This time she's prepared. He slides her chair to the tabl

dialogues.speaker: INT. LIVING ROOM, LATER THAT NIGHT
dialogues.text: The candles have burned down, casting a romantic glow  throughout the apartment. Louis Armstrong's "What a Wonde World" plays. Kate and Leopold sit on the couch sipping w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, where was I? So after my father  died I had to go to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you had many jobs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Many. I got fired from all of them.  I'm the most unskilled person I know.  But they were just survival jobs  while I was still in school. I always  knew I wanted to go into science  like my father. And I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you miss him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think about him every day. He was  courtly, just like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you are a remarkable woman  Katherine Coles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just don't get out much. You'd  be surprised how remarkable I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it is you who would be surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss. Anxiously they stare into each other's eyes. T kiss again. Slowly, Kate leads him to her bedroom door. T look at each other, deciding. Deliberately, cautiously, Kate opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate puts her fingers over Leopold's lips. Gently she lea him inside. They slowly embrace as the door closes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunlight floods the room. Clothes are scattered about. Tw figures lie curled up together sleeping in bed. One of th figures rolls around. The covers are pulled back revealin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold wearing a bathrobe is pouring coffee. The table i set for a huge breakfast. Kate also in a robe enters from the hallway. There is a moment of awkwardness as they see each other for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss shyly. Kate notices the feast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look what you've done!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing? My own mother never made me  a breakfast like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will have to have a talk with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About last night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls out a chair for her and kneels beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate, I had never before been a  considerate man. I had, with  astonishing complacency, squandered  my life, waiting for some incentive  to force me into action. You have  made me see how rare our time here  really is. I am most beholden to you  Kate. And always will be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sense the word "BUT" entering into  this any minute now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold takes her hands in his. She looks at him defensiv bracing for worst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do me the honor Katherine, of becoming  my wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate lets out a very girlish, high pitched scream

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall I take that as a "yes"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold! Did you just ask me to marry  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's entirely beside the point...  You're moving way too fast here.  Shouldn't we date first? I mean it's  obvious the first one went well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where I come from that's pretty much  the way it works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold, even though last night we...  loved each other, that doesn't mean  this morning we're engaged. It just  doesn't work that way now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking a ring off  his fingers and  placing it on hers) I have loved you since I first set  eyes on you. I cannot imagine my  life without you beside me. I want  to marry you, Kate and make an honest  woman of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Leopold, sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They switch places. Leopold sits and Kate kneels beside h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relationships these days are much  more complicated than that. Women  today have certain freedoms that men  have been taking advantage of for  centuries. You must have been aware  of that. If you think about it  clearly, it should be obvious to you  that marriage between us is out of  the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you not love me Kate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost inaudible) Don't ever think that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then consider my proposal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll think it over but I can tell  you now the answer is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her. It's impressive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out of breath) Possibly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a knowing smile) I need you beside me. I will not  give up easily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Do what you have to do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie enters. Kate and Leopold become extremely  selfconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (too casual and too  chipper) Morning!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie is immediately aware that something is not quite  right. He studies the two of them and nonchalant sits at table. Kate and Leopold serve themselves breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kate) Coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate nods. As Leopold pours, they look at each other shyl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a pause) I would like some coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Say when.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pours Charlie's coffee until it overflows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadpan) When.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Kate wipes up the table, Charlie notices her ring. He  eyes Leopold suspiciously. Leopold concentrates on his pl Charlie gives Kate a questioning glance. She smiles at hi looking both innocent and guilty at the same time. After beat:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All smile privately and sip their coffee without another  word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buried behind open books and crumpled up paper, Kate labo in earnest. She stops suddenly, almost violently, and studies the not in front of her. The coffee cup falls from her hand and  breaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling from her  office) Kate, are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine! I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She covers her papers and self consciously cleans up her  mess. She sits down slowly and peeks at her notes. She ha SOLVED THE PUZZLE that will send Leopold back. She looks up in disbelief and glances through her window  around the lab. Everyone is hard at work. Helplessly, she stares back at the paper on her desk. She pulls open her drawer and takes out the picture of  Carlson. She stares at it for a long time. She opens her  mouth to call for the others, stops, and looks at the pho Slowly, with great indecision, Kate crumples up the paper She returns the picture to the drawer. After a long momen she opens a book, feigning research, her mind a million m away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold and Kate sit on her bed watching David Lettering. Kate clutches her pillow close to her. She looks over at  Leopold concentrating on the TV with furrowed brow. She s sadly. She takes her pillow and flings it off her bed. Sh snuggles up to Leopold. They watch TV. Together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Central Park in full bloom, Botanical Gardens, The Frock  Museum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold and Kate eat lunch. Leopold scans a newspaper. On the TV over the bar, Bob Dole is speaking out against gun control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Public office is apparently still  the last refuge for the incompetent.  Show me a man who does not want his  gun registered and I'll show you a  man who should not own a gun. What  is a pee-pee girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you reading?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Village Voice. After much  consideration, I have decided it is  time I join the work force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a pee-pee girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps not that, but I am determined  to acquire honest employment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold, I don't know if that's such  a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate, my life back home was beneficial  to no one. I want my new life to  have value. I won't make the same  mistakes twice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to be patient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could conceivably wait my whole  life away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're awfully cute when you get  causey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will not waste any more time. I  must make a difference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Customers fill the aisles. In the center of it all, Leopo is hard at work. He holds a bottle of perfume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try our fragrance? Would you like to  try our new fragrance today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is called, POISON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He squirts some at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! I don't think so. Have you got  PASSION?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth Taylor's Passion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next aisle over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaves. Leopold looks after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Give your mother-in-law what she  really deserves this season. Give  her some POISON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctors enter Kate's office and closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. (the doctors remain  silent) What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a long pause. Slowly Kate realizes the doctors a on to her. She puts down her pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had to go through your computer  to access information. Your  calculations have been verified and  the final course has been set. Leopold  goes back a week from Friday 1:17  a.m.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long were you going to keep it a  secret, Kate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you even going to tell us at  all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not sure? What can you be thinking?  You can't alter the course of history  and assume everything will be okay.  It won't be. He has his own destiny  to fulfill in his own time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) You don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently) He's going back, Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate nods. The doctors slowly leave the room and close th door. Just the sound of the clock ticking. Kate sits at her desk very still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... No, no, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie knocks and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you are. I've only been  hollering for the last...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees her face. Kate's eyes are red and swollen. She la out Leopold's belongings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate? What is it? What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very detached) It's time. Leopold's going back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup. I'll get his things together.  Tell him tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling away) I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't look so fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I am. It was wonderful having  him here, Charlie. He was of  invaluable assistance to the project. (she shrugs) I'll miss him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll miss him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamnit Kate, you love the guy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate remains silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate, don't do this. Please. It's  not right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I supposed to DO, Charlie??  I can't go back. He can't stay. I  can't let him go. I'm not equipped  to deal with this, Charlie. I don't  know how.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me, Kate. Don't! Don't be  the ice princess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beginning to tear up) I'm not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are. You can't live your whole  life under a microscope. You've got  to tell him how you feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breaking down in his  arms) It's too much, Charlie. It's just  too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You owe it to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know I could feel like this.  I really didn't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I looked him right in the eye and  said, 'Ego is nature's compensation  for mediocrity.' I turned and I  walked. He never said a word... He  probably didn't understand it...  Kate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cold) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right? You're awfully  quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was your day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking a long pause) It's time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're sending you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly pushing his  plate away) When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A week from Friday, early morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a mistake, Leopold. It's out  of our hands. We can't POCKET people  from history like stolen jewels. We  haven't the right... I'm sorry. We'll  miss you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do, fall apart?  You'd still be leaving. It wouldn't  solve anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this woman sitting across  from me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to say, Leopold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me that you love me as I love  you. Let me hear you say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate remains silent. Leopold abruptly throws money on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will not do this. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We starts out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold walks out of the restaurant trying to remain calm His emotions get the best of him. Finally, exhausted, he  winds up walking along Central Park South. Hansom Carriages wait to be taken out. He approaches slow He stops along side one of the cabs and strokes the horse head. He looks at the horse for a long time. Then he looks at t skyscrapers surrounding him, deciding what to do. He lays his face against the horse's head, torn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate sits at the dinning room table behind empty Sara Lee boxes, pints of ice cream, beer bottles, and is working h way through the cookie dough. Leopold enters through the  front door, DISHEVELED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good God. Look at you. You look awful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should see what I'm looking at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went back to the restaurant. They  told me you went out looking for me  right after I left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was pound cakes ago. Where were  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a lot to think over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such as?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just where I stand around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a long pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) We should have come up with something  together. I might have been spared  ten or seventy pounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that an apology?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry for what I said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold goes to her. He gently prys cookie dough from her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going. I'm staying here with  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But? You can't! We have no right  to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is my destiny. It is my decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you thought about what you'd be  sacrificing? Your influence? Your  authority?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your family, your whole way of life,  everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not just feeling sorry for me  because I ate the contents of the  refrigerator, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Kate. The single most  miraculous event in my life was not  how I arrived here, but that when I  did, I found you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overwhelmed) Here comes the mushy part!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After much consideration I've come  to the conclusion I no longer desire  a large estate with a full staff and  ornate grounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good, because if you're staying  I'll probably get fired again. What  do you desire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful wife, a small home in  the middle of nowhere, lots of  children, and fine schools with PMS  meetings every other Sunday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...PTA?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PTA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too. I do, Leopold. I  love you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold and Kate sit calm and resolute. The doctors are i an uproar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is outrageous! I won't allow  it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The decision is not yours to make.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you realize what you're saying?  You're tampering with fate,  preordinance, and God himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do that every day, doctor. It is  called CHOICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Carlson is still over there. You  can't simply abandon her. We have to  get her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think I'm not aware of that?  Do you think a minute goes by that I  don't feel responsible for her? But  SOMEONE ELSE CAN GO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only one person can return. The  capsule accommodates only one person.  Leopold has to find her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps she does not wish to return.  Perhaps she's found greater happiness  in her new life. It happened to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe this is her destiny. Maybe  she's of more important use back  there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julia Carlson died in the Center  Factory fire of 1897, two years after  she arrived. She was 37 years old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a stunned silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear lord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was a friend, Kate. She was never  expected to sacrifice her life for  this experiment. I won't be a party  to it. I know what I'm asking...  There's no way we can force you to  go. Just think it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A clock is ticking loudly. Kate and Leopold lie back to b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going back aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I keep seeing that poor woman's face.  She was terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you wouldn't leave me...  I've never been lucky. Not one time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six months ago I wouldn't have given  it another thought. I wouldn't have  lost a moment's sleep. You've changed  me, Kate. There is no turning back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't WANT you to change. That's  what's tearing me up inside. Either  way I lose... You've changed me too.  I can't go back to my old life  anymore. I can't live like that again.  God my heart is pounding like a drum.  I've never been so scared in my life.  Take me with you, Leopold. God. Take  me with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't realize what you're saying!  You don't understand the kind of  life you'd lead. What you'd be giving  up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd be with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't ask that of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just ask me... Just ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come back with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slowly turns. She embraces him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dressed to the nines, Leopold leads a blindfolded Kate th the street. She is clumsier than usual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you taking me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is something I've wanted to do  for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes off her blindfold and looks up at the sign:  ROSELAND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This will be very therapeutic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes her arm and escorts her in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold leads Kate to the dance floor. He opens his arms Kate steps in the way she was taught in class. Leopold pu her close. This time there is no pretending. Partnered together, the shine. They move beautifully, effortlessly. It's almost m than they can bear. As the music plays, they stop. Leopol holds Kate tightly. They look at each other for the longe time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Large screen computers are working overtime. Kate, Leopol and Charlie accompany the doctors to the capsule. It is n time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The time tables have been set. Just  strap yourself in and you'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have only a twenty four hour  leeway before the machine is set to  return to us. You must find Carlson  within that time frame and get her  on board or there will be little  chance of her finding a way back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been a real pleasure. You have  a much nicer smile than Ronald  Coleman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The privilege was mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye Leopold, and thank you. (she gives him a kiss)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. We'll send Kate to you...  as soon as possible. I'll see to it  myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See that you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have my word on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctors leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four minutes and counting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well? I'll make this quick. Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sticks out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye. (impulsively Leopold  embraces Charlie) I shall miss you Charles, more than  you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll miss you too, Leopold... You're  the only one who knows how to program  the VCR... Take care of my sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better. Take care of yourself  too while you're at it... So long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have any words for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will see you soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be with me all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I brought you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes out a ring and slips it on his finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you wouldn't forget me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you wouldn't think this was all a  dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Kate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For as long as it takes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will come back to you! I will!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss again for the last time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time Leopold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold holds Kate's face in his hands. Very slowly they  part. Leopold takes his place in the machine and straps himself in. He places one hand on the red lever and the other aga the glass pane on the door. Kate comes over and places he hand over his. Wordlessly, they say goodbye. After a moment, Dr. Kau gently moves Kate away. Dr. Plodd silently raises his arm, signaling Leopold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leopold shifts in his seat, his eyes never leaving Kate's his hand still against the glass. Kate smiles tenderly at Leopold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Plodder drops his arm signaling Leopold. Leopold pull the lever, still gazing at Kate. There is a blinding FLAS of light, then darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate raises her head. She sits at her desk surrounded by doctors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cannot in good conscience let you  go. It's out of the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't be a part of it either Kate.  I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too big a risk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate rises and moves to the window. She is a full NINE MO PREGNANT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We cannot guarantee your child's  safety. It's that simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's waiting for me. I can feel it.  Oh, Leopold...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gazes out the window, searching the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down from the horizon, a farm house. LEO COLES, 5 years o rocks on his front porch swing. Using his bare hands as  puppets he carries on a conversation. JULIA CARLSON pulls in her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Does Katherine Coles live here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (yelling inside) MOM??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Leo aren't you? You don't  remember me but I knew you when you  were yea big. (she holds her hands  an inch apart)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Julia. I'm an old friend of your  mothers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (proudly) We had spaghetti at our house 4 times  this week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate comes out on the porch. She looks lovely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo you don't have to holler like  that. I'm not deaf...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Carlson?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two women scream, run to each other and embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlson, I don't believe it. It's  been... I don't know how many years.  What are you doing here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came to see you, sweetie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember my son, Leo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've just been getting acquainted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, come inside. Come inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate heads straight for the kitchen. Carlson scans the li room before joining her. Although rustic on the outside, the inside of the house i furnished with antiques and is Victorian in style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (covering her agitation) Would you like some tea? I wish you  had called before you come over. It  would have given me a chance to  straighten up the house... myself...  my life. Tell me what you've been up  to. Catch me up on everyone. I heard  you received some big endowment or  something. I was going to write,  then call, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks up the cup and saucer but it shakes so violentl she has to put it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right, Kate. I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a LONG PAUSE. Carlson gets the tea ready. Finall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd leave in 9 days. That's not a  lot of time to get your affairs in  order... And I warn you, it's nearly  impossible for an intelligent woman  back there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate stands by the back door, looking out at Leo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a fine boy Kate. Leopold would  be proud. We're aware of your  situation but we felt when the time  came, you deserved the option.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate nods, trembling slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate stands in the doorway as Carlson drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that lady?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just an old friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What she want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she looks at Leo) Nothing important. You brush your  teeth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo shows off his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then give your old mom a hug and go  to bed. (Leo gives her a hug  and a kiss) Good night, cookie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate wraps herself in an old blanket and moves through th house turning off the lights. It is very guiet. All we he are Kate's footsteps and the sound of the clock ticking. She makes her way upstairs, enters her bed room. She sits down by the window at her desk. She sits a long time lost thought. She slowly pulls open a drawer and from deep inside pulls out an old photo album. She opens it and begins to look  through.

dialogues.speaker: THE PHOTO ALBUM
dialogues.text: Inside, old black and white photographs, newspaper clippi magazine articles trace Leopold throughout his life. A photograph of Leopold looking as he did the night he  departed this world. He stands stiffly beside his family a formal portrait. Very discreetly, he points to a ring. is the same ring Kate gave him. A newspaper article shows Leopold donating $100,000 to  establish a scientific center researching studies in time and space. A magazine picture shows Leopold, the sole male figure,  marching to give women the vote. A photograph of a large formal wedding. Leopold, around F stands alone in the wedding party, surreptitiously pointi to his ring. A magazine article shows Leopold in his SIXTIES establish a scholarship program for studies in physics. He is surro by academia and subtly points to his ring. A photograph of Leopold around SEVENTY shaking hands with Albert Einstein and smiling broadly for the cameras. A professional photograph of Leopold at SEVENTY FIVE, sit regally in a chair. Beside him, an EMPTY chair. He rests hand on the back of the chair. The other he holds against his chest, showing off the ring. An obituary with the headline, "Philanthropist, 80, dies bombings. A tear falls on the page. Kate cries silently, looking out the window. The camera  follows her gaze past her property...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEO, 24 and his BRIDE take to the floor for the first tim as husband and wife and are greeted with applause. Kate,  older, beautiful, hair cut short, looks on in wonder. Charlie, standing with Patrice and their 6 blonde childre approaches Kate and leads her to the dance floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's so YOUNG, Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's old enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at that idiotic expression on  his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course he's happy. All weddings  are happy. It's the living together  afterwards that causes all the  trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
