dialogues.text: Julia Carlson, under dressed, over anxious, enters the ba hall. She stands at the back of the large room, searching Couples fill the dance floor. Across the expansive room,  over the tops of heads, Charlie and Kate bob amongst the  guests. Leo cuts in. As they spin, in the briefest of sec Kate spots Carlson. She pales. They TURN. Kate peers over Leo's shoulder. Her eyes lock with Julia' Julia nods with purpose. Kate holds onto Leo tightly, not wanting to let go. She buries her head in his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you're so young... I love you,  Leo. Always remember that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From behind, her shoulders shake as she cries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, we're only moving to Denver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, cookie. I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From behind a glass partition, Carlson works at her conso A monitor counts away the seconds. 59, 58, 57... In the  darkened lab, Kate, dressed in early 1920s attire, straps herself in and smiles tearfully. Their voices echo in the lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They embrace each other for the last time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What will I do without you, Charlie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Live happily ever after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pushing the intercom  button) Kate, it's time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emotionally) Here. It's a letter for my father.  Tell him about me and... um, tell  him I love him. I want him to know  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, I want you to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his finger to her lips. He looks to his wife then back at Kate. He nods his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They force themselves to smile, trying to get through the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, Leo and his new bride stand back. Inside the cra the only light comes from the glowing red lever. Carlson  raises her arm, signaling Kate. Then to her staff:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate presses her hand against the glass as a final goodby She grabs the lever with her other hand and turns away,  staring straight ahead. Charlie puts his arm around Leo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a BRIGHT WHITE FLASH. Kate is gone. The others s there motionless, stunned. The screen is BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FLASH of light illuminates the forest at the Albany est A BEAT. Kate races from the forest onto a massive lawn,  stumbling in mud as she hurries to the mansion's entrance

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huge double doors open to reveal -- AN ORNATE BALLROOM. T creme de la creme have gathered and dance. Kate overwhelm rushes down an elaborate staircase. Half way down she loo a shoe. She hesitates briefly then continues to the dance floor. In the center of the floor, Leopold, looking very  distinguished and attractive, dances with a flirtatious y woman. Try as she might, Leopold keeps her at a distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (brushing his shirt  front) I just love a starched white shirt.  It's so elegant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skeeky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. You dance like an angel Miss  Beall. You light up the room around  you. I thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a big smile) Thank YOU.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music changes: A LIVELY CHARLESTON. Leopold heaves a  sigh of relief and makes his way through the crowd, up th staircase. The dancers become an intricate maze, a dead end at every turn as Kate searches each male face. In the foreground, Leopold is stopped by a woman midway u the stairs. As they chat, Leopold reaches down and picks the muddy slipper, offering it to her. She turns in a huf flouncing down the stairs. Simultaneously, in the background, Kate desperately looks for Leopold. Leopold studies the slipper as he makes his way up the st He slows down, hesitates and STOPS. Very slowly he turns  around. He becomes very still. TEARS well up in his eyes. The ballroom clock strikes MIDNIGHT. Kate climbs an opposite staircase to get a better view th STOPS. In her heart SHE KNOWS. Slowly she turns. Leopold  stands quietly at the bottom of the stairs, gazing up at  her. He extends his arm, showing her THE RING. He offers his hand. The crowd, the room, THE WORLD AROUND THEM, DISAPPEAR. Th eyes lock. As she descends the staircase, THE YEARS MELT  AWAY. Kate's short hair grows long, cascading around her  shoulders. The fine lines around Leopold's face are gone. They see themselves through each other's eyes, at the mom of youth, when they fell in love. Leopold bends down, places the slipper on Kate's foot. He rises, looks down at his hands and then up at Kate. His h are caked with mud. She smiles helplessly. Not caring, he wraps his arms tightly around her. MUSIC begins to play, a slow waltz. He nods to her. She t a deep breath. Her head bobs in rhythm. She begins to cou silently. Leopold smiles, counting along. THEY DANCE... An elderly couple watch Leopold with interest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is that dancing with Leopold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never seen her before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate and Leopold dance past. They are older. As they gaze into each other's eyes, they twirl. THE LOOK OF YOUTH RET At the center of the floor they stop dancing. THEY KISS. rest of the world dances around them. Over this background... THE SCRAPBOOK PICTURES BLEED ONTO SCREEN. The old formal wedding photo becomes a photograph of Kate and Leopold the perfect bride and groom, both discreetly  point to their rings. Kate stands with Leopold as he establishes a scholarship studies in physics. The old photograph of Leopold and Albert Einstein changes include Kate, waving and smiling broadly for the camera. The professional photograph becomes a double portrait. It shows the two in their 70's, sitting regally in matching  chairs. They hold hands and smile serenely. Staring direc into the camera, they show off their rings. SLOWLY the scrapbook closes... Kate and Leopold dance, the music swells as they become l in the crowd. The clock CHIMES. Slowly we...
